result.execSummary:
The defendant Oscar Mauricio Avila Carrillo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

1:39 PM 22CM13Prosecuting attorney John Luetscher in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Oscar Mauricio Avila Carrillo in court.  Attorney Megan Carollo in court for Oscar Mauricio Avila Carrillo. 22CM10 Defendant Rodrigo Romero Arellano in court.  Attorney Alex James Sickel in court for Rodrigo Romero Arellano. Interpreter John V in court. Cases 22CM13 and 22CM10 are called and heard together as defendants are co-defendants. Court makes stmt. Charge has been amended to ordinance violation. State makes stmt regarding the reason for amendment on the record. State request $200 fine plus costs totaling $456.50. Defendant Arellano enters plea of NO CONTEST. Defendant Carrillo enters plea of NO CONTEST. Court accepts the pleas. Adjudged guilty. Atty Sickel makes stmt. Atty Carollo makes stmt. Each defendant has $250 cash bond on deposit. Defendants ordered to pay the balance of $206.50 within 30 days 11/26/2022.
Email confirmation w/ John V/Interpreter 10/26/2022 hrg
